PLAY.TITLE: The Tragedy of Richard the Third

PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae

PGROUP.PERSONA: EDWARD, Prince of Wales, afterwards King Edward V.
RICHARD, Duke of Gloucester, afterwards King Richard III.

PERSONAE.PERSONA: HENRY, Earl of Richmond, afterwards King Henry VII.
LORD STANLEY, Called also EARL of DERBY.
SIR ROBERT BRAKENBURY, Lieutenant of the Tower.

PGROUP.GRPDESCR: Gentlemen attending on the Lady Anne.

PERSONAE.PERSONA: ELIZABETH, Queen to King Edward IV.
MARGARET, Widow of King Henry VI.
DUCHESS of YORK, Mother to King Edward IV.
LADY ANNE, Widow of Edward Prince of Wales, son to King Henry VI; afterwards married to Richard.
A young Daughter of Clarence [MARGARET PLANTAGENET]

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same. Another street.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter the corpse of KING HENRY the Sixth, Gentlemen
with halberds to guard it; LADY ANNE being the mourner

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GLOUCESTER
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: He lays his breast open: she offers at it with his sword
Here she lets fall the sword

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt LADY ANNE, TRESSEL, and BERKELEY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH, RIVERS, and GREY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. London. The palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV sick, QUEEN
ELIZABETH, DORSET, RIVERS, HASTINGS, BUCKINGHAM,
GREY, and others
Exeunt some with KING EDWARD IV and QUEEN MARGARET

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter the DUCHESS OF YORK, with the two children of CLARENCE

Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH, with her hair about her
ears; RIVERS, and DORSET after her
Enter GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM, DERBY, HASTINGS, and RATCLIFF
Exeunt all but BUCKINGHAM and GLOUCESTER

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. London. The palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter the ARCHBISHOP OF YORK, young YORK, QUEEN
ELIZABETH, and the DUCHESS OF YORK

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. London. A street.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
The trumpets sound. Enter the young PRINCE EDWARD,
GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM, CARDINAL, CATESBY, and others
Enter the Lord Mayor and his train
Enter young YORK, HASTINGS, and the CARDINAL

A Sennet. Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM
and CATESBY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Before Lord Hastings' house.
SCENE III. Pomfret Castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter RATCLIFF, with halberds, carrying RIVERS,
GREY, and VAUGHAN to death

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The Tower of London.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter BUCKINGHAM, DERBY, HASTINGS, the BISHOP OF
ELY, RATCLIFF, LOVEL, with others, and take their
seats at a table
Exeunt all but HASTINGS, RATCLIFF, and LOVEL

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. The Tower-walls.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM, in rotten armour,
marvellous ill-favoured
Enter the Lord Mayor and CATESBY
Enter LOVEL and RATCLIFF, with HASTINGS' head

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. The same.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter a Scrivener, with a paper in his hand

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. Baynard's Castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM, at several doors

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BUCKINGHAM
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Enter the Lord Mayor and Citizens

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter GLOUCESTER aloft, between two Bishops.
CATESBY returns

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Before the Tower.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter, on one side, QUEEN ELIZABETH, DUCHESS OF
YORK, and DORSET; on the other, ANNE, Duchess of
Gloucester, leading Lady Margaret Plantagenet,
CLARENCE's young Daughter

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. London. The palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Sennet. Enter KING RICHARD III, in pomp, crowned;
BUCKINGHAM, CATESBY, a page, and others

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Before the palace.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH and the DUCHESS OF YORK
Enter KING RICHARD III, marching, with drums and trumpets

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Lord Derby's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter DERBY and SIR CHRISTOPHER URSWICK

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Salisbury. An open place.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter the Sheriff, and BUCKINGHAM, with halberds,
led to execution

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The camp near Tamworth.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter RICHMOND, OXFORD, BLUNT, HERBERT, and others,
with drum and colours

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. Bosworth Field.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter KING RICHARD III in arms, with NORFOLK,
SURREY, and others

Enter, on the other side of the field, RICHMOND,
Sir William Brandon, OXFORD, and others. Some of
the Soldiers pitch RICHMOND's tent

Enter, to his tent, KING RICHARD III, NORFOLK,
RATCLIFF, CATESBY, and others
Exeunt RATCLIFF and the other Attendants

Enter DERBY to RICHMOND in his tent, Lords and
others attending
Enter the Ghost of Prince Edward, son to King Henry VI
Enter the Ghost of King Henry VI
Enter the Ghosts of RIVERS, GRAY, and VAUGHAN
Enter the Ghosts of the two young Princes
Enter the Ghost of LADY ANNE
KING RICHARD III starts out of his dream
Enter the Lords to RICHMOND, sitting in his tent

Re-enter KING RICHARD, RATCLIFF, Attendants
and Forces

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Alarum: excursions. Enter NORFOLK and forces
fighting; to him CATESBY

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Another part of the field.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Alarum. Enter KING RICHARD III and RICHMOND; they
fight. KING RICHARD III is slain. Retreat and
flourish. Re-enter RICHMOND, DERBY bearing the
crown, with divers other Lords
